metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13133 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
ImageMagick before 7.0.8-50 has a memory leak vulnerability in the function ReadBMPImage in coders/bmp.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced by: https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/3b48d20df53ad048af05107aa1850c344466b082 in imagemagick6, the equivalent patch did not introduce the issue, so not affected: https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick6/commit/210474b2fac6a661bfa7ed563213920e93e76395

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3').
